data.title: Movies – Page 32 – Gateway Film Center
data.meta_description: World Premiere, Fantasia Film Festival 2023. A fine artist named Charlie wreaks chaos in his small town when he becomes a warewolf that doesn't remember the violent crimes he commits. With only papers to report the havoc the next day, the town is in disarray as they try to piece together what or who the culprit is. | Country: United States | Language: English
data.text:
World Premiere, Fantasia Film Festival 2023. A fine artist named Charlie wreaks chaos in his small town when he becomes a warewolf that doesn’t remember the violent crimes he commits. With only papers to report the havoc the next day, the town is in disarray as they try to piece together what or who the culprit is. | Country: United States | Language: English

Read More

The lead visual effects artist on Everything Everywhere All At Once (2022) makes his directorial debut. Nominated for an audience award at the 2024 SXSW Film Festival, the film follows a father and his twin teenage sons as they fight to survive in a remote farmhouse at the end of the end of the world. | Country: Ireland, United States, Canada | Language: English

Read More

A prequel to the iconic 1976 classic. A woman’s faith is shaken when she discovers a chilling plot in Rome aimed at bringing forth the embodiment of evil, prompting her to question everything she believes. | Country: United States, Italy | Language: English

Read More

Herbert West has a good head on his shoulders… and another one on his desk. Columbus late-night legend, Fritz The Nite Owl hosts genre classic Re-Animator (1985). The film will screen, breaking every 20 minutes or so for Fritz’s on screen host segments providing trivia about the making of the film and other fun anecdotes. | Country: United States | Language: English, German

Read More

World Premiere at the 2023 Venice Film Festival. In a near future in which artificial intelligence is in control of everyone’s lives, human emotions are perceived as a threat. | Country: France, Canada | Language: English, French with English subtitles

Read More

In Las Vegas, two best friends—a casino executive and a mafia enforcer—compete for a gambling empire and a fast-living, fast-loving socialite. | Country: United States, France | Language: English

Read More

On every street in every city, there’s a nobody who dreams of being a somebody. Paul Schrader’s gritty screenplay depicts the ever-deepening alienation of Vietnam Veteran Travis Bickle, a psychotic cab driver who obsessively cruises the mean streets of Manhattan. | Country: United States | Language: English, Spanish

Read More

The next film from the director of Poor Things (2023) is a triptych fable following a man without choice who tries to take control of his own life; a policeman who is alarmed that his wife who was missing-at-sea has returned and seems a different person; and a woman determined to find a specific someone with a special ability, who is destined to become a prodigious spiritual leader.

Read More

Official Selection, Cannes Film Festival 2023. A collection of stirring vignettes following everyday people from all walks of life as they navigate the cultural, religious, and institutional constraints imposed on them by various social authorities, from school teachers to bureaucrats. | Country: Iran | Language: Persian, English

Read More

The feature directorial debut of Caitlin Cronenberg, daughter of legendary filmmaker David Cronenberg, is a dystopian satire taking place over a single day, mere months after a global ecological collapse has forced world leaders to take extreme measures to reduce the earth’s population. | Country: Canada | Language: English

Read More
